Vodafone Group's charitable giving focuses on several key areas through its Vodafone Foundation. The company's efforts are directed towards health and education, particularly in underdeveloped regions, and it has been actively involved in responding to crises such as the COVID-19 pandemic.

Their initiatives include the Instant Network Schools program, providing digital education to children in crisis regions, as well as health-related projects like DreamLab, which uses mobile phones to help research cures for diseases like cancer. Additionally, the Vodafone Foundation supports local community charities through employee fundraising initiatives and matches donations. They have also worked to improve access to digital technology and healthcare, such as by facilitating eLearning and providing free medical consultations

They partner with educational organizations to support STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) education and workforce training, aiming to develop future leaders in energy and technology. Additionally, Shell invests in community skills and entrepreneurship programs, particularly in areas that are part of their global operations, such as Nigeria. These initiatives are designed to foster local economic development and improve access to education and employment
